Method Detail

addMetadata

public void addMetadata(java.lang.String key,
                        java.io.Serializable metadata)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Description copied from interface: SerializableMetadata
Associates a serializable metadata to the current object.

If a metadata already exists with the same key, then its value is replaced by the newly given one.

Attribute keys have to be unique, and no overriding of existing attributes is allowed.

Specified by:
addMetadata in interface SerializableMetadata
Parameters:
key - the key
metadata - the metadata
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException

getMetadata

public java.io.Serializable getMetadata(java.lang.String key)
Description copied from interface: SerializableMetadata
Returns the metadata that is associated to this object from its key.

Specified by:
getMetadata in interface SerializableMetadata
Parameters:
key - the key
Returns:
the metadata value, or null if not defined

removeMetadata

public void removeMetadata(java.lang.String key)
Description copied from interface: SerializableMetadata
Removes a metadata from its key.

If none metadata having the given key exists, then this method has no effect.

Specified by:
removeMetadata in interface SerializableMetadata
Parameters:
key - the key

setMetadatasMap

Description copied from interface: SerializableMetadata
Sets the Metadatas Map. Only here for special purposes: Preferably, use SerializableMetadata.addMetadata(String, Serializable) and SerializableMetadata.getMetadata(String).
